question: Climate change is real, that is, it is taking place
Manifestations of climate change differ from one climatic region to another
Climate change is inevitable because of the nature and style of the modern life
Climate change is nothing else than natural fluctuation in temperatures of the Earth
The human community can control climate change
Overall, climate change is bad; it is more harmful than beneficial
Climate change is the tangible, long-term change in weather variables that is associated with the increases in the concentrations of the green house gases in the atmosphere
Scientific evidence on climate change is non-reliable
The average minimum and maximum temperatures never increased anywhere on the Earth since 1900
It is too late for the human community to do anything to stop climate change or reduce it
Environmental pollution resulting from industry is the main cause of climate change
Effect of human activities on temperatures of the surface of the Earth is not high
Burning of fossil fuel like oil and coal contributes to climate change
Deforestation is one of the causes of climate change
The cause of climate change is the global warming associated with the increases in concentrations of the green house gases in the atmosphere
The transportation sector does not contribute substantially to climate change
Climate change resulted mainly from the ozone hole
Climate change is a result of natural processes like volcanoes rather than human activities
Agricultural activities such as animal and plant production contribute to climate change
The sector with the highest contribution to climate change is the energy sector
Climate change causes biodiversity loss
Climate change brings about drop in temperatures of the Earth all over the World
Climate change leads to soil fertility increase
The human community currently experiences the effects of climate change and suffers from them
Rise in water level in seas and oceans and submergence of islands and adjacent lands are results of climate change
Climate change leads to decrease in incidence of contagious and infectious plant, animal, and human diseases
Decline in plant and animal food production, and, hence, deterioration of food security, may result from climate change
Shortage of water that is suitable for domestic use and for irrigation of plants and animals may result from climate change
Climate change may cause an increase in the frequency and intensity of extreme weather conditions such as heat waves, drought, hurricanes, and heavy rains in some areas in the world
Climate change contributes to increased wind and water erosion of soil
